summary: Build an app for SW PROFESSIONAL focused on cosmetic hair care products (shampoo, hair mask, hair serum) promoting reduced hair fall, smoother hair, and a stronger scalp.
architectural_notes: Adopt a dark-mode/premium dark background as the primary visual theme across landing and product views.

existing_features.title: Create a public landing page for the app named “SW PROFESSIONAL” that clearly presents the brand and its hair-care positioning around: 0 level hair fall, smoothing hair, and strong scalp & hair.

Add a product browsing experience that includes three products—Cosmetic Hair Shampoo, Hair Mask, Hair Serum—with individual product detail views/sections containing: product name, short description, key benefits aligned to the positioning (reduced hair fall, smoothing, scalp strength), and a call-to-action section (e.g., “Learn more” / “How to use”).

Define and apply a coherent visual theme suitable for a premium cosmetic hair-care brand (distinct colors, typography, spacing, components) and enforce it consistently across the landing and product views. Do not use a blue/purple-dominant palette.

Add the required generated images as static assets and render them in the UI (hero + brand mark + product visuals). Store generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend.
Make the SW PROFESSIONAL app render in dark mode by default (dark background) across the landing page, product overview cards, product detail sections, navigation, and footer.

Ensure the provided images are used throughout the UI (hero banner, brand logo, and three product images) and remain visually legible on the dark background (adjust overlays/containers if needed, without replacing the images).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create core app content structure for SW PROFESSIONAL hair care products (shampoo, hair mask, hair serum) with positioning around reduced hair fall, smoothing, and scalp strength.

Implement a minimal Motoko backend endpoint that provides the product catalog data (the three products and their fields) to the frontend, so the frontend renders content from the canister rather than hardcoding it in UI components.
Update the UI visual theme to use a dark background while keeping a premium cosmetic look and using the provided product/brand images.
